title: 115_s1556
content:
The "Authorized Rural Water Projects Completion Act" includes provisions for the establishment of a fund for rural water construction, definitions, restrictions on rural water projects, and infrastructure implementation. The "Authorized Rural Water Projects Completion Act" establishes the Reclamation Rural Water Construction and Settlement Implementation Fund and defines key terms such as "Fund," "Indian tribe," "rural water project," and "Secretary." The Reclamation Rural Water Construction and Settlement Implementation Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States, consisting of deposited amounts and interest earned. Within the Fund, there are accounts for the Rural Water Project and Reclamation Infrastructure. Deposits are made to the Fund. The Secretary of the Treasury shall deposit $115,000,000 annually in the Reclamation Rural Water Construction and Settlement Implementation Fund from 2018 to 2038. $80,000,000 goes to the Rural Water Project Account, and $35,000,000 to the Reclamation Infrastructure and Settlement Implementation Account. These amounts are available without further appropriation and are in addition to other rural water funds. The Reclamation Rural Water Construction and Settlement Implementation Fund receives $115,000,000 annually from 2018 to 2038. $80,000,000 is allocated to the Rural Water Project Account, and $35,000,000 to the Reclamation Infrastructure and Settlement Implementation Account. No amounts can be deposited if it would increase the deficit. SEC. 104. EXPENDITURES FROM FUND. The Secretary may expend up to $115,000,000 annually from the Fund, along with accrued interest, for fiscal years 2018 through 2038. Additional expenditures beyond $115,000,000 are allowed if funds were not fully utilized in previous years. Any additional amounts referred to in paragraph (1) must be retained within the designated account, accrue interest, and only be spent for authorized purposes. SEC. 105. The Secretary invests a portion of the Fund not needed for withdrawals. Interest and proceeds from obligations held in the Fund are credited to it. SEC. 106. Required amounts are transferred monthly from the Treasury's general fund to the Fund based on estimates by the Secretary of the Treasury. Adjustments are made for any discrepancies. SEC. 107. The termination clause is included. SEC. 107. TERMINATION. The Fund will terminate on September 30, 2038, with the remaining balance transferred to the reclamation fund established in 1902. In fiscal years 2018 through 2038, the Secretary may allocate at least $80,000,000 from the Rural Water Project Account to complete construction of rural water projects authorized before the enactment of this Act or projects with feasibility studies submitted by February 27, 2015, and authorized by Congress after the enactment of this Act. The Secretary cannot use funds from the Fund for operation and maintenance costs of rural water projects authorized under section 201. The Secretary must establish programmatic goals before expending any funds from the Fund to ensure timely completion of construction for authorized rural water projects, aligning with relevant laws and the Reclamation Rural Water Supply Act of 2006. The funding prioritization criteria for distributing funds under this title consider the urgent need for potable water supplies, current project completion stages, financial needs, economic benefits, and regional water supply capabilities. The authorized rural water project must prioritize minimizing water and energy consumption, promoting renewable energy resources, addressing the needs of Indian tribes and other communities, and considering additional factors determined by the Secretary to allocate available funds effectively. TITLE III--RECLAMATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND SETTLEMENT IMPLEMENTATION

SEC. 301. RECLAMATION INFRASTRUCTURE AND SETTLEMENT IMPLEMENTATION. For fiscal years 2018 through 2038, the Secretary must use at least $35,000,000 from the Reclamation Infrastructure and Settlement Implementation Account to compensate Indian tribes for land use related to hydropower generation or for project construction and implementation authorized by Congress. The Secretary must use funds to compensate Indian tribes for land use related to hydropower generation or project construction authorized by Congress, or to resolve litigation regarding Indian tribes' rights to access, use, or manage water resources.
